turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: This is not a woman!

turns.speaker: FETTES
turns.text: It was a woman when we put her in.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: Hold that lamp up -- I must see her face.

turns.speaker: GEORGINA
turns.text: Are you a doctor, too?

turns.speaker: FETTES
turns.text: Not yet.

turns.speaker: GEORGINA
turns.text: You'll be a good doctor.  I know all about doctors.

turns.speaker: GEORGINA
turns.text: What you really want to ask me is about my back, isn't it -- about where it hurts?

turns.speaker: FETTES
turns.text: Why, yes.

turns.speaker: GEORGINA
turns.text: Well --

turns.speaker: FETTES
turns.text: Hear him?

turns.speaker: GEORGINA
turns.text: The white horse.  The horse that is going to greet me when he sees me.

turns.speaker: FETTES
turns.text: An old acquaintance, eh?

turns.speaker: FETTES
turns.text: Why do you want the white horse to bid you "good-day"?

turns.speaker: GEORGINA
turns.text: He was a nice horse.

turns.speaker: FETTES
turns.text: Maybe there's another reason. Maybe you haven't friends enough. Could that be it, Georgina?

turns.speaker: GEORGINA
turns.text: Of course -- I don't have friends. That's because I can't walk.  I try to make myself used to it.

turns.speaker: FETTES
turns.text: One shouldn't get used to the wrong things, Georgina.  You want to walk and run and play.

turns.speaker: FETTES
turns.text: Aye, but I still wonder how much.

turns.speaker: GEORGINA
turns.text: I want it --

turns.speaker: FETTES
turns.text: But you'll have to stand great pain, Georgina.  Greater pain than you ever dreamed of in the worst time of your sickness.  Do you want it that much?

turns.speaker: FETTES
turns.text: Don't you want to find the white horse, Georgina?  You can't find him from a wheelchair.  You have to walk and run to find him.

turns.speaker: GEORGINA
turns.text: I can't.

turns.speaker: GEORGINA
turns.text: I thought this was a school day.

turns.speaker: FETTES
turns.text: I am not at the school anymore. I left last night.

turns.speaker: FETTES
turns.text: You'll not need that again, Georgina.

turns.speaker: GEORGINA
turns.text: I wanted to see the white horse --

turns.speaker: MRS. MACBRIDE
turns.text: He'll not leave the grave -- not since Wednesday last when we buried the lad.

turns.speaker: FETTES
turns.text: Your son, ma'am?  He must have been a fine boy for the wee dog to love him so.

turns.speaker: FETTES
turns.text: Not much danger here, ma'am, I wouldn't think -- right here in the heart of Edinburgh.

turns.speaker: MRS. MACBRIDE
turns.text: They're uncommon bold, the grave robbers -- and the daft doctors who drive them on.

turns.speaker: FETTES
turns.text: I'm by way of being a medical myself.

turns.speaker: MRS. MACBRIDE
turns.text: A doctor?

turns.speaker: FETTES
turns.text: A student.  I'm studying under Dr. MacFarlane -- that is, I've been studying until today --

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: Come, Toddy -- come.  Sit down here with me.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: Don't call me that confounded name.

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: Well, then, Doctor MacFarlane -- although I've known a time, Toddy, when you liked the name.  Aye, and many are dead now who called you by it; rough and wild ones they were, too.  But come Toddy, sit down here with your young friend.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: Mr. Fettes and I have professional matters to discuss.

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: Medicine?  That'll keep.  Sit down.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: I will not have you use that name to me.

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: You will not have it?

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: You're a teacher, eh?  Maybe you're afraid to be a doctor, Toddy.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: Afraid of what?

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: Afraid you are not as good a doctor perhaps as you make out to be.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: I am the best man for the job.

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: Why don't you do it then?

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: You?  Why?  Since when have you become the protector of little children?

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: I'm not concerned about the child, Toddy.  It's you I'm thinking of, I'd like to see you prove that a lot of things I know haven't hurt Toddy MacFarlane any.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: I'll not do it, Gray.

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: Oh, yes, you will.  You'll do it to oblige Fettes and myself.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: Maybe there's some private reason between you and me which will make you -- some long lost friend of ours.  Say that you'll do it for me and my friend, Mr. Fettes, here.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: It might be an interesting case.

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: That's a good boy, Toddy.

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: Toddy hates me.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: Don't call me that confounded name, I tell you.

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: Hear him?  Did you ever see the lads play knife?

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: Now that wasn't a friendly thing I heard, Toddy.  Not at all friendly.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: That has nothing to do with it. We've decided to do more lecturing and less dissection -- it's better for the students -- that's all there is to it.

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: You know what you want and don't want -- so that's an end of business between us -- but we'll still be friends, Toddy.  I'll be dropping by to see you and Meg once in a while -- for auld lang syne, you know.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: I suppose we can't prevent that, Gray --  -- for auld lang syne.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: Oh, it's you, Gray. Well, come in. Sit down. Have a glass with me.

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: You're uncommon friendly tonight, Toddy. More like the old days.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: You know something about the human body, Gray.

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: I've had some experience.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: Then you can understand that the backbone is a lot of little blocks and those little blocks are all held together, so that it works like that whip of yours. You know that, don't you?

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: I've never had it all explained that way to me by so learned a man.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: I set those blocks together, patched the muscles. I put the nerves where they should be -- I did it and I did it right -- and she won't walk --

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: Oh, it's the bit of a girl Fettes was talking about.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: The same. Look here, Gray --

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: You can't build life like you put together blocks, Toddy.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: What are you talking about? I am an anatomist. I know the body. I know how it works.

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: And you're a fool, Toddy -- and no doctor. It's only the dead ones that you know.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: I am a doctor. I teach medicine.

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: Like Knox taught you? Like I taught you? In cellars and graveyards? Did Knox teach you what makes the blood flow?

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: The heart pumps it.

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: Did he tell you how thoughts come and how they go and why things are remembered and forgot?

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: The nerve centers -- the brain --

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: But what makes a thought start?

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: In the brain, I tell you. I know.

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: You don't know and you'll never know or understand, Toddy. Not from me or from Knox would you learn those things. Look --

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: I am a doctor - a good doctor. I could make her walk, but she won't - she won't --

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: Here, have another glass, MacFarlane. I'll take you home and we'll be friends again -- now that you know that you're Knox's man and my friend -- aye, forever.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: Why should I be afraid of you? What are you holding over me?

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: I'll tell you what, Toddy. It's because I ran down the streets with the mud and the stones around my ears and the mob yelling for my blood. It's because you were afraid to face it -- and you're still afraid.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: No, I'm not afraid. Tell! Shout it from the housetops!  And remember this -- they hanged Burke -- they mobbed Hare -- but Dr. Knox is living like a gentleman in London.

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: Aye, Toddy, there is something in what you say.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: There is much in what I say, Gray, and if you have any regard for your neck you'll leave now and stay away from my house, my school, and from me.

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: I have no wish for a rope cravat. I've never liked the smell of hemp, so I'll bid you good night, Doctor MacFarlane.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: What are you going here? Have I not told you --

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: Would you grudge me a glass with my old crony, Meg?

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: I brought you something tonight, MacFarlane -- an interesting specimen -- in very good condition.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: I've ordered nothing from you.

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: This is a gift.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: I take no gifts from you.

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: This is a gift you'll not return.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: Get out of here!

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: Wait, Toddy. That's not hospitable. I want to discuss business.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: You are not to set foot in here again, Gray, for business or any other reason. And you're going out now!

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: Gray, I must rid myself of you -- you've become a cancer -- a malignant, evil cancer -- rotting my mind.

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: So, Toddy, you've made me a disease, eh?

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: I can't understand your hurt to me -- but I must cut you out.

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: Surely you are not threatening an old friend, Toddy.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: We have never been friends.

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: Have another glass of something good, Toddy.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: I've drunk enough tonight.

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: Another little drop'll never do you any harm.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: You're getting old, Gray, and it's a hard life driving a cab through these wet and windy streets of Edinburgh --

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: I have other means of sustenance.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: The Resurrection business? That may end sooner than you think. New laws may come.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: What I was going to say is this -- wouldn't you be more comfortable at Leith in a neat little house?

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: Would you bribe me to leave you be?

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: I would make you rich.

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: It wouldn't be half so much fun for me. Toddy, as to have you come here and beg --

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: Beg -- beg of you! You crawling graveyard rat!

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: Well then -- I beg you -- I beseech you --

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: But then I wouldn't have the fun of having you come here and beg again, Toddy.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: But why, Gray? Why?

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: Because it would be a hurt to me to see you no more, Toddy. You're a pleasure to me.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: A pleasure to torment me?

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: No -- a pride to know that I can force you to my will. I'm a small man -- a humble man -- and being poor, I've had to do much that I did not want to do. But so long as the great Dr. MacFarlane jumps at my whistle, that long am I a man -- and if I have not that, I have nothing. Then I am only a cabman and a grave-robber.

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: I presume you shall.  This won't be my last visit here.

turns.speaker: JOSEPH
turns.text: I want to speak to you alone.  I saw something.  I heard.

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: What did you hear?

turns.speaker: JOSEPH
turns.text: I know --

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: You're welcome to my little nest, Joseph -- is it not? That's right -- you have something to say to  me -- something very private.

turns.speaker: JOSEPH
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: Now that is very interesting --  Take a chair, Joseph,

turns.speaker: JOSEPH
turns.text: Can anyone hear what we say?

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: Only Brother.

turns.speaker: JOSEPH
turns.text: I know that you kill people to sell bodies.

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: You say you've come here on your own account?  No one knows you are here?

turns.speaker: JOSEPH
turns.text: Give me money or I'll tell the police you murder the "subjects."

turns.speaker: JOSEPH
turns.text: I have made you give me money, but you smile. Aren't you angry?

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: No, Joseph. I'm not angry -- here -- another glass of brandy --I'll wager it's better than the doctor's.

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: You and I should work together.

turns.speaker: JOSEPH
turns.text: You mean we would sell the bodies to the doctors together? Dig them up?

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: No digging Joseph. The churchyards are too well guarded. We will "Burke" them,

turns.speaker: JOSEPH
turns.text: Burke them?

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: You are lately come to Scotland, Joseph?

turns.speaker: JOSEPH
turns.text: I come from Lisbon.

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: But still you may have heard the peddlers of verse cry out their names on the streets.

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: "The ruffian dogs, the Hellish pair.  The villain Burke, the meager Hare --"

turns.speaker: JOSEPH
turns.text: I never heard that song. But what did they do?

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: Eighteen persons they killed and sold the bodies to Dr. Knox at ten pounds for a large and eight pounds for a small. That's good business, Joseph.

turns.speaker: JOSEPH
turns.text: But where did they get those people?

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: That was Hare's end. Ah, you should have seen him on the streets, when he saw some old beldam deep in drink how he cozened her!

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: "A good-day to you Madame Tosspot, and would you like a little glass of something before you take your rest? Come with me to my house and I'll make you my guest. You shall have quarts to drink if you like."  Ah, how he cozened them.

turns.speaker: JOSEPH
turns.text: We could do that. But when he had them there, then what?

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: "Nor did they handle axe or knife To take away their victim's life -- No sooner done than in a chest They crammed their lately welcome guest."

turns.speaker: JOSEPH
turns.text: I don't understand the song. Tell me plain how they did it.

turns.speaker: GRAY
turns.text: I'll show you how it was done, Joseph. -- I'll show you how they "Burked" them.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: Was the paralysis immediate?

turns.speaker: MRS. MARSH
turns.text: No, Doctor.  She seemed to get better, then about six months later she began to complain of pain in her back --

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: How long after that was the paralysis complete?

turns.speaker: MRS. MARSH
turns.text: Nearly a year.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: Any attacks of pain since?

turns.speaker: MRS. MARSH
turns.text: Yes, Doctor.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: Is her pain sporadic or constant?

turns.speaker: MRS. MARSH
turns.text: It comes at intervals.  They used to be months apart -- but they've been growing more frequent --  much more frequent.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: See here, child, when you have this pain in your back, where is it?

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: Child seems to take to the lad. What sort of an accident was it, Ma'am?

turns.speaker: MRS. MARSH
turns.text: A carriage overturned.  My husband was killed and Georgina was hurt.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: How long ago?

turns.speaker: MRS. MARSH
turns.text: Three years.

turns.speaker: MRS. MARSH
turns.text: But can anything be done for her?

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: Perhaps -- a delicate operation -- an operation which has never been performed -- but it could be performed.  I'm sure it could be -- I could incise the columna dorsi --

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: Believe me, Madame, if I were only a doctor, I would undertake this operation at once.  But I'm more dominie than doctor -- I've a school to run.

turns.speaker: MRS. MARSH
turns.text: But, Doctor, surely in a case like this -- a child -- a little child who can never walk or run --

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: I regret it, Ma'am, but I have the responsibility of training thirty other doctors to attend a thousand children like your own.

turns.speaker: MRS. MARSH
turns.text: There's nothing I can say for one small child?

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: I'm not heartless, Ma'am.  I have every sympathy for you and for the little girl, but if I were to consent to every operation brought to me, I'd have no time for teaching -- and that's a great responsibility upon me, Ma'am -- a great responsibility.

turns.speaker: MRS. MARSH
turns.text: I'm sorry, Doctor.  Georgina's a good child -- a brave child -- you saw how she was during the operation -- but if she can't move, she can't move.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: But she must be able to move. Everything is in place.

turns.speaker: MRS. MARSH
turns.text: She would if she could.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: Then all my surgery is no good. There's something wrong with the child -- something I don't know -- something I can't define -- can't diagnose.  I can do nothing for her.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: And why not?  He's a good lad -- bright and able.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Aye.  He's a good lad.  That's why I ask you, MacFarlane.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: You think it'll spoil the boy, eh? Was I not assistant to Knox?

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Aye --

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: Did it spoil me, Meg, my lass?

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: You're daft.  What's Gray to me. He's only a man from whom I buy what I need when I need it -- the rest is forgotten.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: You may deny the devil, Toddy, but you'll not rid yourself of him by saying the devil is dead.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: Nonsense.  You're a fey creature with mad ideas.  But you have a wildness that holds me to you, lass.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: No great lady will ever take my place?

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: Crony indeed!

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: You can get out.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: Fettes -- where is Fettes?

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: I'll get him.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: You're not going to Gray.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: He must leave me alone.

turns.speaker: MEG
turns.text: You've been with Gray again.

turns.speaker: MACFARLANE
turns.text: Aye.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: I hate that picture.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Where are they?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Can I get you something? A glass of water? A transfusion?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Where are they? Last chance.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Or what? You'll bleed all over my carpet?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: around, or whatever the hell you're doing here.  What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: I'm looking for my friends.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: See, I heard you were looking for some guy with a scar. How's that going? You find him? Yes? No?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: How many innocent people did you leave dead back there?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: You sent them. I had no choice.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Bullshit. You're a killer, that's all you are. A clown with a bird and a rising death toll. You think the world did you wrong?! You did the world wrong.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: It was one thing her dad rejected you. But when she did you lost it.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: You're wrong.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Yeah?  I see doubt oozing out your arm. Where do people go when they kill their girlfriends?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Was that it? Well, ok.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: I'm not dying for your goddamn illusions. You got that? You think you and your girlfriend had some rosy future ahead of you? Bullshit. She was already bored, why do you think she was looking around? You're nothing, Corvis! Less than nothing.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: What's been holding me together is the hope that maybe you do go someplace. And I'll be seeing her again soon. Only what will I say? That I was too stupid to find the guy who killed her? That he's down here laughing?

turns.speaker: WALSH
turns.text: Tell her... we'll get him.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: We won't.

turns.speaker: WALSH
turns.text: Someday he'll surface and I'll get him for both of you. I promise. I'll find the guy with the scar.

turns.speaker: WALSH
turns.text: Check and mate.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Dream on.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Two down. Two to go.

turns.speaker: WALSH
turns.text: "Down?" Wait, don't tell me.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: The cops from my trial. They killed Lauren. The whole thing was fixed.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: You think I'm crazy.

turns.speaker: WALSH
turns.text: I'm thinking... that explains a lot.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Lauren's father's involved. He bought the cops fancy cars, I don't know what else. It's a company called D-E-L-T. I think Lauren found out.

turns.speaker: WALSH
turns.text: What do they do that they had to kill her?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: I was hoping you'd find out.

turns.speaker: WALSH
turns.text: Yeah. I sure will.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Leonard, Dutton, Erlich. They don't matter. I want the King.

turns.speaker: WALSH
turns.text: We're getting there. Because in his so-called construction job, Tommy makes a daily delivery to a place called "The Hole."

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: The strip joint?

turns.speaker: WALSH
turns.text: I believe they call it a connoisseur's club. Owned by DELT.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Where is it? This place?

turns.speaker: WALSH
turns.text: I think we should get some support?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: What? Call the police?

turns.speaker: DUTTON
turns.text: That was a fucking hollow point!

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: I guess it's true. Guns don't kill people...

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Think maybe knives do?

turns.speaker: DUTTON
turns.text: Keep that thing away from me.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: This is not just some "thing." It's A C zero zero five.

turns.speaker: DUTTON
turns.text: Fuck! What do you want?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: A scar. On the arm. Of the man who planted this in Alex Corvis's car.

turns.speaker: DUTTON
turns.text: There's no scar, you freak. The Corvis kid made it up.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: You killed her. I saw it.

turns.speaker: DUTTON
turns.text: Bitch killed herself when she shot a cop in the leg. If she' just acted like a girl nothing would have happened.  So you're right, spooky. Happy?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Sssshhh. She's resting.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Where the fuck did you come from?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Big bang, primordial ooze, divine hand of a benevolent creator?  All possibilities. Although recent events have given me doubts about the benevolent creator.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: You lied at my trial.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: I don't know you, man.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Capital case nine nine dash C one one five. Alex Corvis.  Exhibit A.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Hey. I said what I saw. Two kids arguing. A guy and a girl.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: You said you saw me with this. I never held it until today.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: What's your damage, man? Corvis hacked up that girl like a motherfucker.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: One chance to tell the truth, Tommy. Who is the man with the scar? He planted this in my car.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: There's no scar. Corvis made it up.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Wrong. Answer.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Who are you?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: What did they give you?

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: They showed me pictures, what he did to her. Evidence. Said all I had to do was stand up there and not my head "yes."

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: What did they give you?

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: A job. Construction. Twelve an hour.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: We're going to play a little game called "Who's got the Scar."

turns.speaker: TOOMEY
turns.text: What Scar? What fucking scar?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: AAAANK. That's not how we play the game.

turns.speaker: TOOMEY
turns.text: You're him! You're Corvis! We fried your ass. You're dead, man!

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Good thing in a situation like this.

turns.speaker: TOOMEY
turns.text: Fucking Zombie.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: The scar.

turns.speaker: TOOMEY
turns.text: There is no scar. I'm telling you.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: I heard you were looking for this.

turns.speaker: ERLICH
turns.text: You're the guy killed Dutton.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: I want you to think of me as the guy who killed you.

turns.speaker: ERLICH
turns.text: Fuck. Me.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: What happened to your leg there Officer? Hunting accident?

turns.speaker: ERLICH
turns.text: Not my arm! What you fucking want?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: I want Lauren. I want my life back. I want... to know why.

turns.speaker: ERLICH
turns.text: Why? Why's anything happen? It's all money, man. Money. The girl just got in the way.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: The scar. Which of you has it?

turns.speaker: ERLICH
turns.text: Nobody.

turns.speaker: ERLICH
turns.text: Are you out of your fucking mind? We're going to die.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: How can you die if you're already dead?

turns.speaker: ERLICH
turns.text: You're him. Corvis.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: I was talking about you.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: I was a friend of your sister's.

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: I know her friends.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: That locket you're holding. You have one just like it.

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: Yeah, no kidding.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Your father gave them to both of you.

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: And he's right over there by the way.  What did you do to your face?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Someone else did it.

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: You're a friend of the guy who killed her, aren't you? You almost sound like him.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: He didn't kill her.

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: How do you know?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: I know everything about your sister. I'll prove it to you.

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: Stay away from me! Dad! Dad!

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: Daisy. How did you know?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: I told you, I knew your sister.

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: You killed that cop Dutton.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: And another one. There. Erlich. Took a wrong turn.

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: I know who you are.  That's why you paint your face. To hide.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: I'm not hiding. I'm right here.

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: You killed Lauren! You killed her!

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: I've been shot, and stabbed and thrown from a car and none of it hurt. But what you're doing now, does. I don't know why.

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: My dad was right! He said you'd ruin her life.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: No. Listen to me. Lauren found out something they didn't want her to know.  This.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: From the bonfire over there. Look at it.

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: No! Why are you haunting me?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Because you need to understand. And you need... to be careful.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: This is where it happened. Right over here.

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: Yeah, I know.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Are you ok?

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: When Lauren was missing the police came to our house. They said they were looking for her, right?  But I know now they had her, and the reason they brought her here and knew the could blame it on you...

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: ... is that I sent them here. I told them she came here sometimes. With her dirtball boyfriend. That's exactly what I said.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Erin. It's not your fault.

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: It's all my fault. Oh God. I wish I were dead.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: No. You don't.

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: Yes I do, I really do.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: This tree. Here's where it happened.

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: I don't want to see!

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: ... took everything I ever cared about. Left me with nothing.

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: So you're going to kill him?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Have to find him first.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: You know what Lauren and I were fighting about that night? She had a secret, wouldn't tell me...

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: My father.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: All I knew, she was pulling away. It made me crazy.

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: I used to be so proud of him. My big deal daddy. And now, he's just a crook. Worse even. And the weird thing is...

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: I wish I could hate him but I can't. He said he'd never hurt either of us, and I know it's true and... I'm going back.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: It's what Lauren would do.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: It's ok, it's ok...

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: It's not. I can't take it.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Erin. Who?

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: I don't know. I found him lying there.
